beer.name: The Lawnmower
beer.description: This is our take on an American Light Lager fermented as an ale. It’s light-bodied, clean, and refreshing. It’s perfect to quench your thirst while mowing the yard, washing the car, picking the weeds or any other chore that needs to be done.

This is our take on a historic beer style called a Kentucky Common! The name originates from the year the beer was first created and documented. It originated in Louisville, Kentucky and was brewed from 1902 up until prohibition. It was one of Louisville’s most popular beer styles until prohibition killed it off. Unfortunately, the beer style was never revived after prohibition up until recently with a few craft brewers experimenting with it. The taste is sweet with a bready, biscuit, toffee taste up front with a creamy taste on the backend. Do not let the color fool you, it is very light and easy drinking!

beer.name: Dick & Willie
beer.description: Named after the famous Railroad that ran through Henry County now turned into the famous walking trail. Tasting notes of dark chocolate, coffee, oatmeal, and a hint of maple syrup. This is an easy drinking dark beer.

beer.name: Tricorn
beer.description: Named after the hat worn by revolutionary war soldiers and officers, this IPA has a blend of three hops: Galaxy, Amarillo, and Citra. This was made for our hop heads! Tasting notes should include passionfruit, grapefruit, lime, and clean citrus brought on from this blend of hops. Hints of caramel and malt may be tasted. General Joseph Martin possibly could have been wearing this hat when he claimed “Scuffle Hill” as his land.

beer.name: The Big Chair
beer.description: This is our flagship Blonde Ale, hopped with El Dorado and Huell melon giving it a sweet taste with hints of melon. The name “Big Chair” comes from the worlds largest chair that was manufactured by Bassett Furniture and used to be displayed in Uptown Martinsville.

beer.name: Da 'Rona
beer.description: Our Mexican Cerveza is light hopped, clean and refreshing with a slight aroma of lime peel. It’s served best with a fresh slice of lime while you sit outside and enjoy some fresh air during this quarantine.

beer.name: A Lighter Shade of Pale
beer.description: A single hopped Hazy Pale Ale, made with Vic Secret hops. It has a sweet taste with hints of mango, citrus, and pineapple accompanied by a slight hoppy bitterness.

beer.name: Pineapple Seltzer Water
beer.description: Crisp, bubbly and refreshing hard seltzer water with tasting notes of sweet pineapple.

beer.name: Fall Beer Sucks
beer.description: Dry hopped w/ Ahtanum, Amarillo, Mosaic, and East Kent Goldings! Brewed for the people that are already tired of pumpkin beers, this IPA is 7.0% and 70 IBUs with a malty caramel backbone accompanied by tasting notes of citrus, orange peel, grapefruit, and floral hoppiness!

beer.name: Grandaddy's Apple Pie
beer.description: A spiced Apple Ale brewed with cinnamon, nutmeg, fresh gala apples, apple cider, and Madagascar vanilla bean! Clocks in with a 7.5% ABV and 16 IBUs. It’s like apple pie in a glass!

beer.name: Campfires & Canteens
beer.description: A German Rauchbier with a malty, toasty richness with a smoky taste that almost resembles flavors of bacon, just like you’d find in Germany.

beer.name: Darkwater Project
beer.description: Full of citrusy and resinous aroma and flavors accompanied by a smooth aftertaste of Chocolate! Dry hopped w/ cascade and nugget!

beer.name: Deshazo’s Silo
beer.description: This is our take on an English Special Bitter. Don’t let the word bitter scare you, it brings sweet flavors of caramel and dark fruits accompanied by a very slight earthy bitter. Named after the “Deshazo’s Silo” found on the Dick & Willie trail. It was used as an incinerator for the G.M. Finley’s sawmill in the early 1900s.

beer.name: Hoppin' Haze
beer.description: Dry hopped with Centennial, Amarillo, and Simcoe. A sessionable hazy pale ale with tasting notes and aroma of light citrus, dank, earthy, and hoppy! Named after Hayes Panill who used to be a freight car hopper in Henry County!

beer.name: Country Inn
beer.description: Named after the old “Country Inn” motel in Oak Level, this beer provides tasting notes of sweet chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit flavors.

beer.name: Strawberry Seltzer Water
beer.description: Crisp, bubbly and refreshing hard seltzer water with tasting notes of sweet strawberry. Made with real strawberry puree!

beer.name: Scuffling Up Hops
beer.description: This version of our NEIPA Series is brewed and dry hopped with Citra, Citra Cryo, and Azacca Hops to bring fruity hoppy flavors and aroma of intense citrus, grapefruit, orange, melon, lemon and lime!

beer.name: The Big Chair w/Coffee
beer.description: We took our “The Big Chair” Blonde Ale base and threw in some coffee given to us from our friends at “The Ground Floor” to give us a blonde ale with a nice light coffee flavor! This one is for our coffee lovers!

beer.name: Margarita Seltzer Water
beer.description: Crisp, bubbly and refreshing hard seltzer water with tasting notes of a nice green margarita!

beer.name: Orange Pomegranate Wheat
beer.description: A nice refreshing wheat beer made with fresh orange and pomegranate!

beer.name: Evergreen IPA
beer.description: Brewed and Dry hopped with CTZ, Chinook, Simcoe, Nugget and Evergreen hops! This IPA brings a nice juicy orange citrus flavor upfront with a smooth spicy, herbal, and piney bitter on the back end.

beer.name: 0 Dark 30
beer.description: Dark as the night when you wake up to PT at “0 Dark 30”, this imperial chocolate stout just tastes like smooth, dark chocolatey goodness. It’s full of body and was brewed with cocoa cereal, cocoa nibs, and cocoa powder.

beer.name: Dam Sour w/ Cherry
beer.description: A sour ale brewed with fresh Tart Cherry and Black Cherry bringing a nice tart cherry sour! Named after the Philpott Dam!

beer.name: Fog Of War
beer.description: Named after the term Fog of War, which is used to describe anything that disorients you in combat! This IPA brings nice flavors of cherrywood smoke, spicy rye, and a earthy, herbal bitterness and aroma from the chinook and warrior hops!

beer.name: Pröst
beer.description: Meaning Cheers in German, is our German Hefeweizen with an American twist! Bringing mellow flavors of banana and clove traditional to a Hefeweizen, with a slight citrusy orange flavor coming from the small dry hop of Cascade and Amarillo we added!

beer.name: Piers Plowman
beer.description: A light bodied Milkshake Brown Ale, bringing nutty, milk chocolate flavors upfront with a nice creamy chocolate and vanilla finish, resembling chocolate ice cream. Made with fresh Cocoa Powder, Madagascar Vanilla Bean, and Milk Sugar. *CONTAINS LACTOSE* “Ne noon halfpenny ale in none wise drynke, But of the beste and of the brunneste that brewesteres selle” – Piers Plowman “Best and brownest” could be taken to indicate that the browner the beer the better, and thus more popular.

beer.name: Neely's Red
beer.description: Our take on a traditional Irish Red Ale bringing a toasty, malty backbone with a slight earthy bitterness. It also has a nice amber, red color!

beer.name: Field-Ale
beer.description: A Belgian Saison named after the local community of Fieldale! Bringing traditional Belgian flavors of banana and clove accompanied by the fresh black and tart cherry additions. The dry hop of Idaho Gem and experimental hop HBC 630 accentuate those flavors more by providing more hoppy cherry flavors!

beer.name: Dam Sour w/ Mango
beer.description: A sour ale brewed with loads of fresh mango puree bringing a nice fruity mango flavor! More of a fruity mango ale then a sour this time around!  Named after the Philpott Dam!

beer.name: Galaxy Smash
beer.description: This pale ale was made solely with only one grain and one hop. Dry hopped and brewed with galaxy hops to bring out a passionfruit, citrus, and peach aroma and flavor with a slight piney bitterness.

beer.name: Killen's DIPA
beer.description: This is a homebrewer spotlight showcasing local homebrewer, Braydon Killen’s, Double IPA recipe. This DIPA brings an assertive grapefruit zest bitterness supported by the malty caramel backbone, and finishes with a floral & earthy hop note, accompanied by a grapefruit, citrus, and pine aroma!

beer.name: Double Berry Wheat
beer.description: A Wheat Ale brewed with fresh blackberry and raspberry puree, bringing a nice fruity berry flavor!

beer.name: Dam Sour w/ Cherry
beer.description: A Sour Ale brewed with fresh tart cherry and black cherry, bringing a nice sour cherry flavor!

beer.name: The Big Chair w/ Strawberry
beer.description: Our Flagship Blonde Ale “The Big Chair” bringing all the flavors from the original plus some nice fresh strawberry flavors! Made with fresh strawberry puree!

beer.name: Legend of Bernard
beer.description: A historic beer from Poland made with 100% oak smoked wheat! Bringing slight oaky, smoky flavors accompanied by a nice wheat body!

beer.name: Tom Collins Seltzer
beer.description: Crisp, bubbly and refreshing hard seltzer water with tasting notes of sweet, tangy lemon, orange, and grapefruit! All the tastiness of a Tom Collins mixed drink, just without the Gin!

beer.name: Easy Peasy
beer.description: Crisp, bubbly and refreshing hard seltzer water with tasting notes of sweet, tangy lemon, orange, and grapefruit! All the tastiness of a Tom Collins mixed drink, just without the Gin!

beer.name: The Big Chair w/ Cantaloupe
beer.description: Our Flagship Blonde Ale “The Big Chair” bringing all the flavors from the original plus some nice fresh cantaloupe flavors! Made with almost 50lbs of fresh cantaloupe!
